You must declare that all information provided in this application is true and correct

I authorise you to credit the cash payments payable by the Government into the bank account specified below. The authorisation shall continue to be in force until I have expressly revoked it by notice in writing to you. I understand that you may in your absolute discretion terminate this arrangement by giving written notice to my official address
* I declare that all information provided in this application is true and correct

* I agree that all the information provided in this online form may be shared with the organisations appointed by MSF to

(i) open and manage the Child Development Accounts (CDAs) and

(ii) send me reminders and notifications related to the Baby Bonus Scheme.
* I accept all terms and conditions for the CDA.
Below is a list of all the applications that you have made over the past 1 year

Request to Transfer from Child Development Account (CDA) to PSEA

This is application for children born between 2006 and 2012 and of 7 years old.

Please select the child/children for whom you are requesting for the transfer.

Note: There is a cap for the balance transfer to PSEA. This cap is determined based on the child\'s CDA cap, maximum Government matching, Child Development Credit and prevailing interest.

On transferring the CDA balance to PSEA, I authorise you to credit any amount exceeding the PSEA cap into my bank account specified below.\n
Accept CDA Bank’s Terms and Conditions
Please select the child/children for whom you wish to accept the CDA Bank\'s Terms and Conditions
Please fill in birth order of all children who are Singapore citizens born alive to the mother, and/or adopted by the mother who is currently a Singapore Citizen
1. Birth order is tagged to the natural mother and not the father.
2. Children who are not Singapore Citizens, given away for adoption, stillbirths and stepchildren are not considered in the counting of birth.
3. Twins and triplets (and other multiple births) are counted as separate births.

Example 1

 Mr A and Mdm B have 3 children (child X, Y and Z) born in January 2007, January 2009 and January 2013. Child X was born in USA and not a Singapore citizen as at January 2013. Child Y and Z are Singapore citizens. Child Y and child Z will be considered as the first and second child respectively for the purpose of Baby Bonus Scheme. Subsequently in June 2013, child X obtained Singapore citizenship and parents inform MSF accordingly. Child Y and child Z will be re-determined as the second and third child.

Example 2

 Mdm C gave birth to 3 children (child E, F and G) in 2002, 2005 and 2013 and they are Singapore citizens. Child E and child F were from her first marriage to Mr L. Subsequently Mdm C remarried to Mr M and gave birth to child G. Child G will be considered as the third child for the purpose of Baby Bonus Scheme.

Example 3

 Mr J has 3 children (child O, P and Q) born in 2003, 2008 and 2013 and they are Singapore citizens. Child O and child P were from Mr J’s first marriage to Mdm H. Subsequently Mr J remarried to Mdm K and she gave birth to child Q.Child Q is Mdm K’s first child. Child Q will be considered as the first child for the purpose of Baby Bonus Scheme.

Example 4

 Mr and Mrs D have 2 children (child Q and R). Child Q was born in December 2005. In February 2006, Mr and Mrs D legally adopted child R who is a Singapore Citizen and born in August 2004. Child R will be considered as the second child for the purpose of Baby Bonus scheme, even though he/she may be older.

Note that this is applicable to children who have not opened a Child Development Account (CDA).

Please select the child/children for whom you are requesting for CDA opening.
* I understand that the child\'s eligibility for the Baby Bonus Scheme is subject to Government\'s verification.
Application for New Baby Bonus Scheme

"This form may take you 10 minutes to complete.

Before you begin, please take note that the following criteria must be met before you can apply:

1) The mother is 8 weeks away from her Estimated Delivery Date (EDD); or the birth of the child has already been registered with the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA) or at any Singapore hospitals one working day before; and

2) The child will be / is a Singapore Citizen at birth or has already obtained Singapore Citizenship;

3) The parents are lawfully married.

You may want to get ready the following documents to complete this form:

1) Both parents' NRIC

2) Nominated Account Holder's personal particulars and Bank Account Details

3) Child Development Account (CDA) Trustee's personal particulars

4) Adoption Order and Schedule (if your child is adopted)

5) Marriage Certificate (if your marriage is registered overseas)

Please click 'Apply Now'. You will be redirected to SingPass for authentication purposes.

For enquiries or assistance, please call the Baby Bonus hotline at 1800-253-7707 (local) or +65-62537707 (overseas); or email msf_babybonus@msf.gov.sg"

You have saved/submitted the below Baby Bonus application(s). Please select the application that you wish to enquire or edit.

For enquiries or assistance, please call the Baby Bonus hotline at 1800 253 7707 (local) or +65 6253 7707 (overseas); or email
msf_babybonus@msf.gov.sg

Draft : Application is saved as draft

Submitted :Application is submitted

In-progress :Application is being processed by MSF

Successful : Application is successful

Unsuccessful :Application is unsuccessful

Application needs action by applicant : Application is pending for amendment/update

Brief description of the mobile web,native mobile application and/or its features

Date released: 27 May 2015
Version: 1.0

Email us to provide your suggestion on Baby Bonus Mobile app via @email

Please note that verification of sibling relationship is only required for recurrent expenses (e.g. monthly school fees), as well as one-off costs above $500.

Enter NRIC/FIN of Child 1 and Child 2 to show the AI that two children are siblings.

If you prefer electronic statements or letters, you may opt-in to OneInbox @ www.oneinbox.gov.sg.

For data confidentiality, all hardcopy letters will be sent to your official address as maintained with the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA).
For Citizens NRIC should prefix S or T.
